metadata.name: trading
metadata.description: Trading program for P2P Energy Trading - Order book and marketplace

instructions.name: authorize_oracle
docs: Authorize a new oracle for meter verification

instructions.name: cancel_auction_order
docs: Cancel an order in an Open auction batch and refund assets

instructions.name: complete_bridge_transfer
docs: Complete a bridge transfer from another chain

instructions.name: configure_payment_token
docs: Configure a payment token (USDC/USDT) for the market

instructions.name: create_buy_order
docs: Create a buy order for energy

instructions.name: create_price_snapshot
docs: CREATE a price snapshot for history

instructions.name: create_sell_order
docs: Create a sell order for energy
Validates that the seller has a valid ERC certificate before allowing the order

instructions.name: create_stablecoin_buy_order
docs: Create a buy order with stablecoin payment option

instructions.name: create_stablecoin_sell_order
docs: Create a sell order with stablecoin payment option

instructions.name: execute_atomic_settlement
docs: Execute a truly atomic settlement between buyer and seller
This performs both currency and energy transfers in a single instruction

instructions.name: execute_batch
docs: Create and execute a batch of orders with physical token transfers
Optimized: Aggregates multiple matches in a single transaction
This implementation uses remaining_accounts to pass all required ATAs:
For each match i, accounts are expected at indices [2 + i*6..2 + i*6 + 5]:
0: Buyer Currency Escrow, 1: Seller Energy Escrow, 2: Seller Currency, 3: Buyer Energy, 4: Fee Collector, 5: Wheeling Collector

instructions.name: execute_settlement
docs: Execute settlement for specific orders in a cleared auction
This is a permissionless crank instruction.
It matches a Bid (buyer) and an Ask (seller) at the Uniform Clearing Price.

instructions.name: execute_stablecoin_settlement
docs: Execute atomic settlement with stablecoin payment

instructions.name: initialize_confidential_balance
docs: Initialize a confidential balance account for confidential trading

instructions.name: initialize_meter_history
docs: Initialize meter history for a specific meter

instructions.name: initiate_bridge_transfer
docs: Initiate a bridge transfer to another chain

instructions.name: match_cross_chain_order
docs: Match a local order with a cross-chain order

instructions.name: match_orders
docs: Match a buy order with a sell order

instructions.name: mint_rec_certificate
docs: Mint a new REC certificate based on verified production

accounts.name: verified_reading
docs: The verified reading that justifies this REC issuance

instructions.name: private_transfer
docs: Private Transfer - Send encrypted tokens between confidential accounts

instructions.name: resolve_auction
docs: Resolve the auction by calculating the uniform clearing price

instructions.name: shield_energy
docs: Shield energy - convert public tokens to confidential balance

instructions.name: submit_auction_order
docs: Submit an order to the current auction

instructions.name: swap_buy_energy
docs: Swap currency for energy via AMM

instructions.name: transfer_carbon_credits
docs: Transfer carbon credits (REC tokens) between wallets
Allows users to transfer their renewable energy credits to other users

instructions.name: unshield_energy
docs: Unshield energy - convert confidential balance to public tokens

instructions.name: update_batch_config
docs: Update the batch processing configuration for the market

instructions.name: update_market_data
docs: Update market data for dynamic pricing

instructions.name: verify_meter_reading
docs: Verify a meter reading with signature and ZK checks

errors.name: WrappedTokenNotApproved
errors.msg: Wrapped token not approved for trading

types.name: AuctionBatch
docs: Represents a batch of orders for a specific time window

fields.name: clearing_volume
docs: Total volume to be traded at clearing price

fields.name: orders
docs: In a real mainnet impl, we might not store all orders active here due to size limits.
We would use a separate Orderbook account or a Merkle root.
For this version, we'll store a capped number of orders for the MVP.

types.name: BridgeConfig
docs: Bridge configuration for the trading market

fields.name: destination_address
docs: Destination address (32 bytes, zero-padded for non-Solana chains)

fields.name: kwh_to_rec_rate
docs: Conversion rate: kWh to REC tokens (scaled by 1000)
e.g., 1000 = 1 REC per kWh, 100 = 0.1 REC per kWh

fields.name: carbon_intensity
docs: Carbon intensity factor (g CO2e avoided per kWh)

types.name: Commitment
docs: Commitment to a private value: C = v*G + b*H

types.name: CrossChainOrder
docs: Cross-chain order structure for multi-chain trading

fields.name: owner
docs: Current owner of the certificate (for transfers)

fields.name: renewable_source
docs: Source of renewable energy (solar, wind, etc.)

types.name: Market
docs: Market account for order and trade management

types.name: MeterCommitment
docs: Meter Data Verification Module for GridTokenX
Provides cryptographic verification of meter readings:
- ZK proofs for meter data integrity
Meter reading commitment (hash of reading + timestamp + nonce)

fields.name: hash
docs: Hash of the meter reading data

types.name: MeterHistory
docs: Meter reading history for anomaly detection

types.name: MeterReadingProof
docs: ZK proof for meter reading validity

fields.name: range_proof
docs: Range proof showing reading is within valid bounds

types.name: OrderPaymentInfo
docs: Stablecoin order extension - stores payment token preference

fields.name: order
docs: Order this payment info belongs to

fields.name: price_in_payment_token
docs: Price in payment token (converted from GRID if needed)

fields.name: exchange_rate
docs: Exchange rate used for conversion (if applicable)

fields.name: base_component
docs: Components that made up the price

types.name: PricingConfig
docs: Dynamic pricing configuration for a market

fields.name: base_price
docs: Base price per kWh (in micro-units, 6 decimals)

types.name: TokenConfig
docs: Token configuration for the trading market

fields.name: enabled
docs: Whether this token is enabled for trading

fields.name: min_order_size
docs: Minimum order size in this token

fields.name: price_oracle
docs: Oracle price feed for conversion (if applicable)

fields.name: last_price
docs: Last known price in base units (for rate limiting)

fields.name: trading_approved
docs: Whether this wrapped token is approved for trading
